intro: Antennaria leucophaea, commonly known as the white-leaved mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, silvery appearance. Antennaria leucophaea thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
